intro: Oxalis acetosella var. rhodantha, commonly known as the redwood wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a low-growing perennial with trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a waxy coating, while the flowers are usually pink or red, adding ornamental value. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. This variant is distinguished by its more vibrant flower color compared to the typical variety.
